meanings.definition: The act of attributing something to a particular cause or source.
meanings.sent1: Her ascription of the noise to the wind was incorrect.
meanings.sent2: The ascription of the painting to the famous artist increased its value.
meanings.sent3: His ascription of the missing cookies to the dog's secret stash made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The ascription of success to luck is often oversimplified.
meanings.sent5: The ascription of blame to the wrong person caused confusion.

meanings.definition: The assignment of a particular quality or characteristic to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The ascription of bravery to the firefighter was well-deserved.
meanings.sent2: Her ascription of intelligence to the robot was surprising.
meanings.sent3: The ascription of magical powers to the cat made the story more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The ascription of beauty to the sunset was poetic.
meanings.sent5: The ascription of kindness to the stranger warmed her heart.
